title: Package Developer
description:
**#MaesaMagic**


*Maesa is the world's largest independent beauty incubator, housing numerous, fast growing "it" brands within all categories of beauty. We are a high growth global company in the middle of the transition from founder lead to private equity owned. With an incubation flywheel ideating on new global brand launches, Maesa pushes creative and technical boundaries to deliver exceptional performance and establish global staying power. Maesa has a keen focus on marketing and white space analysis, which guides its thinking on marketing existing brands as well as development of new brands through its extremely unique structure. We are vertically integrated globally with in-house marketing, branding, product development/formulation, packaging design/engineering and regulatory. With a focus on modernity and sustainability, we design innovative solutions and make proactive choices to achieve environmental neutrality and consumer wellness. Maesa has mastered "commercializing creativity," making itself a leader in the fundamental revolutionary change in the beauty industry. Headquartered in New York and Paris, with additional offices in Los Angeles, Vienna, Dubai, Hong Kong, and Dongguan, Maesa employs about 400 team members worldwide.*



This role is based in NYC and you will be expected in office a few days a week, at minimum.


**Responsibilities**


* Project Management: maintain timetables, costing and managing development for packaging of Turnkey programs
* Responsible for overall form, fit and function of custom tooled projects across multiple beauty categories
* Interact with Creative, Marketing (internal or customer), Product Development, Retailer and or Distribution Center for the timely launch of project
* Ensure all the required testing parameters are accurately performed for package development
* Responsible for direct interface with our China office and North America Factories, ensuring all packaging aspects of the Project are in line with established costs, timing and quality
* Costing, to stay +/- 10 percent in development and plus or minus +/- 5 in production, for documented cost of goods
* Establish Bill of Materials, Fill and Assembly instructions, and Specifications
* Hold Marketing, Sales and Creative in conjunction with Project Manager, manage and update timetables weekly to ensure all parties are aware of critical project dates
* Clear working knowledge of Timetables and Cost Sheets and Development
* Attend weekly internal Production meetings to ensure that open purchase orders are prioritized and production dates are firm and on schedule
* Prioritize workload and critical issues, pertaining to the core development of Turnkey projects
* 24 hour Rule - Making a concerted effort to acknowledge and/or address all inquiries within 24 hours upon receipt
* Additional duties and responsibilities as deemed appropriate by the VP of Package Development, as required and necessary to support the workflow of the department
* Maintain positive attitude & foster a positive working environment at all times


**Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree in Technical field, preferably in Packaging, Mechanical, or Manufacturing Engineering
* 0-5 years of experience in the field or in a related area
* Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within packaging and product management field
* Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals
* Performs a variety of complex tasks. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.
* Able to travel 20% of the time
* Experience working with overseas manufacturers, especially in China
* Have experience with turnkey customed package development and project management.


**What We Offer**



$90,000/yr - $105,000/yr. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. This position is eligible for participation in a discretionary bonus plan based on individual and company performance.



Maesa offers a variety of benefits to eligible employees. Employees can choose to enroll in health insurance coverage, wellness programs, life and disability insurance, and retirement savings plans. Through generous paid time off, a hybrid office setup, and paid leave options, Maesa encourages wellness and balance among employees.


**Our Commitment to You**


* At Maesa, we live by our values of collaboration, curiosity, game-changing, creativity, and discipline. We believe our people and partners are a creative force that catalyzes the possibilities in beauty to break through traditional limits and discover the "new" without restriction. We prioritize creating and fostering a welcoming environment for employees, partners, ideas, approaches, and endeavors — all through a spirit of warmth and inclusivity. As set forth in Maesa's Equal Employment Opportunity policy, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected group status under any applicable law.


#LI-Hybrid
company_description: Maesa transforms the beauty industry by incubating and growing meaningful brands globally.

title: Account Based Marketing Manager
description:
Own is the leading data platform trusted by thousands of organizations to protect and activate SaaS data to transform their businesses. Own empowers customers to ensure the availability, security and compliance of mission-critical data, while unlocking new ways to gain deeper insights faster. By partnering with some of the world's largest SaaS ecosystems such as Salesforce, ServiceNow and Microsoft Dynamics, Own enables customers around the world to truly own the data that powers their business.



It's their platform. It's your data. Own it.

**The Job**
-----------



As **Account-Based Marketing Manager** at Own, you will be responsible for the strategy and implementation of our ABM campaigns and tactics to drive pipeline from target accounts in close partnership with our sales team. Join us on this exciting journey of growth and success.


**Your Day-to-Day Role**
------------------------


* Lead the strategy, creation, and implementation of 1:1, 1:Few, and 1:Many ABM campaigns to support sales goals.
* Design and launch multi-channel ABM campaigns by crafting strategic plans, aligning internal teams, and managing project execution.
* Apply an experimentation mindset to drive, test, learn, and continuously optimize ABM campaigns.
* Use data analysis to iterate and refine campaigns for improved performance and outcomes.
* Collaborate with ABM leadership to identify key accounts and develop targeted strategies.
* Conduct thorough research and analysis to inform ABM strategies and drive effective targeting.
* Ensure transparency and continuous improvement by providing stakeholders with ongoing reporting, campaign insights, and progress updates.
* Partner with regional Campaign Managers, Field Marketers, Account Executives, and Business Development Representatives to build integrated campaign motions that drive results.
* Work closely with operations teams to support the effective use and integration of high-performance ABM marketing tools.
* Document processes and best practices to ensure consistency and provide reference materials for marketing and sales teams.

**Your Work Experience**
------------------------


* + 3-5 years of experience strategizing, developing, and executing ABM campaigns.
	+ Strong understanding of multi-channel marketing strategies.
	+ Proficiency in data analysis and optimization techniques.
	+ Excellent project management and organizational skills.
	+ Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
	+ Experience with ABM tools and marketing technology, Namely, Salesforce, Pardot, and 6sense.
	+ Comfortable using Asana or similar tools for project management.
	+ Proven ability to think communicate well and think strategically, with exceptional attention to detail.

**Important Details**
---------------------



This is a full-time position. The ideal candidate will work out of our Englewood Cliffs, NJ office to maximize collaboration and interaction with the business. Travel may be required.



Own is dedicated to creating an environment where employees thrive, which is why base pay is only one part of the total compensation package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work. This role may also be eligible for unlimited PTO, generous medical benefits, a 401(k) savings plan with a 4% employer match, discretionary bonuses/incentives, and stock options. We also offer catered lunches in the office five days a week, a full fitness center, and free shuttle bus service to and from New York City.



Creating an environment where employees thrive also means making sure every employee feels accepted. As we scale to help all types of companies protect precious data, our team must reflect the diversity we serve. OwnBackup is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we believe that every employee in the company brings a unique perspective that they can and should contribute in order to make an impact every day. We strive to be one team and one culture that builds trust through transparency. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status or disability status.

title: Part Time Driver For Injured Patients
description:
Set your own hours and make a difference in people's lives. At Boomerang Transport you will transport injured workers to their appointments from the comfort of your own vehicle. Rides are scheduled in advance so that you can choose the times that work best for your schedule. You'll also get paid by the hour to wait at the facility when wait time is approved. You might qualify if you meet the following criteria:


* Possess a valid driver's license
* Have a 4 door sedan, minivan, or SUV that is less than 15 years old


The average trip pays $50 and most drivers get 2 trips a week. If interested please apply now. We are excited to have you on our team!


* $0.75 per loaded mile
* Minimum trip pay $11.75 per leg
* Wait time pay
* Gas Reimbursement Plan when national average is over $2.84 (Gas Bonus)
* Tolls & parking reimbursement
* Average trip pays $50, most drivers get 2 trips a week

  
* A minimum age of twenty-five (25) years.


* Possession of a valid driver’s license issued by your state of residence for the type of vehicle to be operated.


* Must be current on personal auto insurance policy.


* Must have an active cell phone plan, however if prepaid and NOT on autopay then must provide proof of 6 consecutive timely payments.


* Must be a US citizen or resident alien with a TIN- Taxpayer Identification Number (SSN, EIN, & ITIN are acceptable).

title: Supervisor, Metadata Operations (Peacock)
description:
**Company Description**  

At NBCUniversal, we believe in the talent of our people. It’s our passion and commitment to excellence that drives NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands to succeed. From broadcast and cable networks, news and sports platforms, to film, world-renowned theme parks and a diverse suite of digital properties, we take pride in all that we do and all that we represent. It’s what makes us uniquely NBCU. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us.

 **Job Description**  

The Post Production team is hiring a Supervisor, Metadata Operations to assist the Metadata & Operations team for our direct-to-consumer streaming service, Peacock. This role will have direct responsibility for creating and optimizing the metadata that appears on our streaming service – from the visible words on the platform to the behind-the-scenes tags fueling platform features. The Metadata Operations Supervisor plays a critical role in ensuring creative and operational excellence across Direct-to-Consumer platforms.

* Responsible for leading and managing a team of metadata professionals including: hiring, training and performance management in a hybrid work environment.
* Oversees the optimization of a high volume of descriptive metadata in English and Spanish where applicable.
* Ensures copy deliverable timelines are successfully met for fast-paced content launches.
* Effectively communicates creative copy specifications with internal and external partners, including detailed style guidance presentations required for successful onboarding.
* Track and derive reporting system defects, reliability and availability. Facilitate monthly/bi weekly status meetings and review of support analytics and productivity.
* Develop pitches and presentations that capture areas of focus and appropriate departmental initiatives functional and technical reporting metrics.
* Identify strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats associated with initiatives and projects.
* Develop cross-functional workflows across organizations within the enterprise, create detailed SOPs as needed, and leverage digital tools to create complex, scalable, and iterative processes.
* Partner with and develop strong stakeholder relationships with business leaders. This includes working closely with O&T business units.
* All other duties as assigned.

  

**Qualifications**  

We are seeking a solutions-minded, critical thinker, and wordsmith who is adept at swiftly handling change in a constantly evolving industry.

* 5+ years editorial copyediting and proofreading experience
* Demonstrated ability to lead projects and influence others without direct authority.
* Excellent writing and presentation skills and must be willing to complete copywriting, proofreading, and keyword tagging test.
* Ability to write in a wide variety of styles (short and long-form), adjusting for purpose, audience, tone, and copy specification guidelines (bilingual in Spanish a plus).
* Film and television subject matter expertise, including a demonstrated interest in current events, pop culture, and sports entertainment.
* The ability to prioritize and concurrently handle multiple, time-sensitive requests in a high-pressure environment.
* Ability to support an ever-changing content pipeline 7 days a week; must be willing to work evenings, weekends, extended hours or holidays as needed.
* Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States.
* Must be willing to travel for business as needed with the potential for short term assignment(s) at NBC facilities.
* **Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week. This position will be based out of our Universal City or Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey office.

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Exceptional technical, analytical, organization, research, and presentation skills
* 2+ years managing and overseeing staff
* Strong team building, vendor, and customer relations skills.
* Familiarity with Gracenote or other metadata aggregation services.
* Strong comfort level with taxonomy management and metadata best practices.
* Curiosity for consumer insight research, cultural nuance, and linguistic diversity.
* Fluency in Spanish language.

**Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.

 **Additional Information**  

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants  

and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation,  

marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services,  

genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories,  

or arrest or conviction records, in a manner consistent with relevant legal  

requirements, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring  

Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the California Fair Chance Act, where applicable.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the  

right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your  

ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can  

request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Bartender (Part-time)
description:
**Looking for a fun and rewarding job where you can hone your interpersonal skills, learn the secrets to providing great customer service and become a hospitality professional, gaining real life experience?**

**Join our team at the Huntington Country Club, a harmonious & collaborative environment where our members are the fabric of our community and treat our staff like family.**

**The Huntington Country Club is a private member club that is very community driven, steps away from downtown Huntington. We offer our members an 18 hole golf course, racquets sports, member events, fine dining, and more.** 

**Position Description & Tasks**

**Title: BARTENDER FT or PT Positions**  
**Reports to: Dining Room Manager**

**Job Overview:**

Set up the bar with all necessary mise en place for your shift. Take beverage orders, serve alcoholic/non-alcoholic beverages to members and servers. Maintain a neat and orderly bar that you can be proud of. Provide an engaging and warm atmosphere for all members, maintaining friendly but professional and attentive service. Be an ambassador of the club and its facilities.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

Take beverage orders from members and servers.

Prepare and serve alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks consistent with the Club’s standard drink recipes.

Learns the names and personally recognize our members.

Record drink orders accurately and immediately after receipt into the POS system.

Wash and sterilize bar tools, glassware as needed, etc.

Prepare garnishes for drinks and offer/replenish snacks for members.

Maintains bottles and glasses in an attractive and functional manner to support efficient drink preparation and promotion of beverages.

Keep bar top clean and attractive at all times to remain welcoming for members.

Present drink/food menus, make recommendations and answer questions regarding beverages. Promote food orders.

Maintain cleanliness in all areas of the bar including counters, sinks, shelves and storage areas.

Receive and serve food orders to members seated at the bar.

Report all equipment problems and bar maintenance issues to dining room manager.

Maintain restocking and replenishment of bar inventory and supplies.

Assist with weekly/monthly inventories as needed.

Research new cocktail/beverage trends and develop new specialty cocktails.

Be available to fill in as needed to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of the restaurant as directed by the restaurant manager or immediate supervisor.

The job duties as listed above are not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Please note that the compensation information provided is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement. It may be modified in the future, pursuant to the New York Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements Law. It is estimated based on what a successful New York applicant might be paid. The Club takes into consideration a candidate’s education, training and experience, seniority, expected quality and quantity of work, external market and internal value, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the New York law, a potential employee’s salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.

Only those lawfully authorized to work in the United States of America will be considered. We are an equal opportunity employer.

**Qualifications:**

Must be 21 years of age.

Be able to communicate and understand the predominant language (English) of our guests.

Have working knowledge of beer, wine and liquor and common drink recipes.

Possess basic math skills and have the ability to operate a POS system.

Be able to work in a standing position for long periods of time (up to 5 hours).

Be able to reach, bend, stoop and frequently lift up to 40 pounds.

Have a positive and upbeat personality.

Must be an energetic team player.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $22.00 - $24.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Pharmacy Marketing Representative
description:
**Position Summary:** The Pharmacy Marketing Representative is responsible for promoting and supporting the pharmacy’s services to healthcare professionals, patients, and potential clients. This role involves developing and executing marketing strategies, establishing and maintaining relationships with key healthcare professionals, and enhancing the overall visibility and reputation of the pharmacy.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Develop and Implement Marketing Strategies:**
* Design and execute comprehensive marketing plans to drive awareness and sales of pharmacy products and services.
* Identify target audiences and create tailored marketing campaigns to meet their needs.
* **Build and Maintain Relationships:**
* Establish and nurture relationships with healthcare professionals, including physicians, pharmacists, and hospital staff.
* Engage with patients and potential clients to promote pharmacy services and address their needs.
* **Conduct Market Research:**
* Analyze market trends, customer preferences, and competitive landscape to identify opportunities and challenges.
* Gather feedback from stakeholders to refine marketing strategies and improve service offerings.
* **Organize Promotional Events:**
* Plan and execute events such as health fairs, product demonstrations, and educational seminars to increase pharmacy visibility and engagement.
* Coordinate with vendors, sponsors, and partners to ensure successful event execution.
* **Develop Marketing Materials:**
* Create and distribute promotional materials, including brochures, flyers, and digital content, to effectively communicate pharmacy offerings.
* Ensure that all marketing materials comply with regulatory standards and brand guidelines.
* **Monitor and Report Performance:**
* Track and analyze the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and promotional activities.
* Prepare and present regular reports on marketing performance, including metrics on reach, engagement, and return on investment (ROI).
* **Collaborate with Internal Teams:**
* Work closely with the pharmacy’s management and staff to align marketing efforts with business objectives.
* Provide training and support to pharmacy staff on marketing initiatives and customer engagement strategies.
* **Stay Updated on Industry Trends:**
* Keep abreast of the latest developments in the pharmacy industry, including new products, regulations, and best practices.
* Attend industry conferences and professional development opportunities to enhance knowledge and skills.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Pharmacy, or a related field.
* Proven experience in marketing, preferably within the healthcare or pharmaceutical industry.
* Strong understanding of marketing principles and strategies.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Proficiency in using marketing software and tools.
* Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to pharmaceutical marketing.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 per week

Experience:

* Marketing: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Edison, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: PM Housekeeping Operations Manager
description:
Description

We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized individual to join our team as a PM Housekeeping Operations Manager at The Empire Hotel. As the PM Housekeeping Operations Manager, you will play a vital role in ensuring the smooth operation of our housekeeping department and maintaining high standards of cleanliness and guest satisfaction.

In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing day-to-day administrative tasks and coordinating housekeeping operations. You will be the main point of contact for housekeeping staff and other departments, ensuring effective communication and timely responses to inquiries and requests. Additionally, you will assist in managing inventory and supplies, and maintaining accurate records.

The ideal candidate for this position is a detail-oriented individual with exceptional organizational and communication skills. You should have a strong understanding of housekeeping operations and be able to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities

* Responsible for ‘closing the house’ daily and making sure all assignments are complete and the department is ready for opening the next day
* Receive all incoming calls and respond accordingly

· Allocate room assignments and tasks to housekeeping staff on PM an overnight team, follow up as needed.

· Maintain communication and follow up with Housekeeping Managers and room attendants with any DND, late services or refuse services during their shift

* Ensure keys are issued in line with security procedures
* Manage guest requests and enquiries immediately
* Ensure all relevant information is communicated to Housekeepers and Front Desk
* Carry out administrative tasks and IT duties
* Act as the sole liaise with front desk to ensure all information is communicated efficiently and promptly
* Ensure that communication has been clear and consistent to all shifts
* Update system regularly to give maximum room return to the hotel/s active inventory
* Work closely with Front Desk Management to ensure the house is up to date and rooms are ready for check in.
* Manage all guest response calls ensure they are completed in a timely manner.
* Assist with inventory management and ordering of supplies
* Ensure compliance with safety and cleanliness standards
* Act as a housekeeping manager during shift by completed room inspections as needed.
* Carry out any other reasonable task set by the Hotel's Management

Requirements

· Proven experience in a similar role in the hospitality industry

· Excellent organizational and time management skills

· Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively

· Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities

· Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills

· Proficient computer skills, including knowledge of MS Office

· Knowledge of housekeeping procedures and best practices

· Ability to work effectively in a team environment

· Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as required

* Partner with and develop strong stakeholder relationships with business leaders. This includes working closely with O&T business units.
* All other duties as assigned.

  

**Qualifications**  

We are seeking a solutions-minded, critical thinker, and wordsmith who is adept at swiftly handling change in a constantly evolving industry.

* 5+ years editorial copyediting and proofreading experience
* Demonstrated ability to lead projects and influence others without direct authority.
* Excellent writing and presentation skills and must be willing to complete copywriting, proofreading, and keyword tagging test.
* Ability to write in a wide variety of styles (short and long-form), adjusting for purpose, audience, tone, and copy specification guidelines (bilingual in Spanish a plus).
* Film and television subject matter expertise, including a demonstrated interest in current events, pop culture, and sports entertainment.
* The ability to prioritize and concurrently handle multiple, time sensitive requests in a high-pressure environment.
* Ability to support an ever-changing content pipeline 7 days a week; must be willing to work evenings, weekends, extended hours or holidays as needed.
* Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States.
* Must be willing to travel for business as needed with the potential for short term assignment(s) at NBC facilities.
* **Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week. This position will be based out of our Universal City or Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey office.

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Exceptional technical, analytical, organization, research, and presentation skills
* 2+ years managing and overseeing staff
* Strong team building, vendor, and customer relations skills.
* Familiarity with Gracenote or other metadata aggregation services.
* Strong comfort level with taxonomy management and metadata best practices.
* Curiosity for consumer insight research, cultural nuance, and linguistic diversity.
* Fluency in Spanish language.

**Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.

title: Program Management & Change Management Consultant
description:
iPostal1 and our parent company USZoom have been pioneering digital mailboxes and mailroom management software since 2007! Our network of digital mailbox locations is the largest and fastest growing with thousands of locations across the U.S. and abroad. We have the most mailbox features and the best customer satisfaction ratings of any digital mailbox provider. We are BBB accredited with an A+ rating.

We are seeking a ***Program Management & Change Management Consultant*** to join our team for a 4-6-month assignment. This is a full-time remote role working Monday - Friday, 9:00 - 5:00 EST with ability to travel to our headquarters in Rockland County, NY as needed.

**Responsibilities:**

1. Support the establishment of our Project Management Office (PMO):

* Support the build out in creating a roadmap for the PMO's implementation and integration within the organization.
* Define the governance framework, including policies, standards, and procedures.

2. Establish a Standardized Project Management Framework:

* Develop and implement a consistent methodology for project management and planning across the organization.

3. Discovery/Audit:

* Conduct discovery sessions with team members to understand current workflows and communication methods.
* Gather insights on team collaboration and identify areas for improvement.
* Document findings and provide actionable recommendations for enhancing team communication and workflow efficiency.
* Analyze team workflows and communication to identify improvement areas.

4. Build a Knowledge Base of Best Practices:

* Create a repository of project management best practices, templates, and tools that can be accessed and utilized by project managers across the organization.

5. Support the Design and Implementation of a Project Management Technical Solution:

* Evaluate, recommend, and implement a project management tool (e.g., Asana, Jira).

6. Enhance Project Execution Efficiency:

* Improve the efficiency and effectiveness of project execution, ensuring projects are completed on time, within scope, and on budget.

7. Manage 1-2 Key Projects:

* Ensure timely and successful completion of 1-2 critical projects.
* Mentor and shadow the Internal Project Manager.
* Transfer knowledge and best practices to the internal Project Manager.

8. Transition and Handover:

* Prepare comprehensive project documentation and handover materials.
* Ensure smooth transition of ongoing projects to permanent project management resources.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Management, Organizational Development, or a related field.
* Certifications such as Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Change Management Professional (CCMP), or Prosci Change Management Certification can be advantageous.
* 5+ years of experience in program management, project management, or change management roles.
* Proven track record of successfully managing complex projects and leading change initiatives within organizations.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to maintain integrity and trustworthiness in handling sensitive information.

iPostal1 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, marital status, disability, military status, genetic information, or any other category protected by law.

Neuropath Behavioral Healthcare provides Comprehensive Youth and Family Support Services to primary caregivers of children and teens with Developmental and Intellectual Disabilities. title: Biotech Medical Sales Representative
description:
If you have previously applied... Please reference this in your question response and we will review your previous application and push it to the top of the list.

Please read carefully before applying. We are not looking for 1000 applications for this position. We are looking for 20 great candidates, that understand the value they bring with them. Willing to put in the work, to receive the rewards. To not saturate markets and territories, we will be making two new hires for the role in your location.

If you do not answer the predetermined questions, we will not review your application for consideration. Thank you in advance.

**Prismexos.com**

Prism Med is a nationwide full service marketing and management company established in 2019. We have seen 3+ years of continuous growth. We have grown organically, by putting our customers’ needs first. A very close second, is our employees. Our compensation structure exceeds market average for medical sales role. Also each year, if you're a fan of golf or great networking events, we fly the Presidential Award winner and a guest of choice, out to the Phoenix Open for an extended weekend. Covering all trip expenses, VIP greenskeeper passes, and a few extras. Rub elbows with the most important business minds and celebrity social circle. People talk about this event throughout the whole year following the event. Never fails. Be a part of something great!

We want to see our contracted workers making a million dollars a year. If you're making money, we are making money. Happy to provide checks with uncapped commissions. We provide market best in commission per sale, along with full transparency to what it takes to get to those kind of numbers. Not a walk in the park, but doable with a modest client base. Average reps doing part time can add 10k per month. If you have relationships with physicians, you can add our industry best Exosomes to your portfolio. The "use cases" are almost endless regarding a variety of ailments. Great for cardiology, pain management, men's health, women's health, regenerative med, integrative med, med spa, geriatric, orthopedic, neurology, Endo, Plastics, Chiro, and many more. Our safe and effective product is ethically sourced human umbilical cord derived MSc. Wharton's jelly. You will not find a better product in regenerative medicine with our concentration of exosomes per cc. If your providers are looking for new age tech that can change their patients' lives, this is it... Nothing is full proof, but our patient testimonials are testing that theory. Join us and add revenue in your book of business. Also add a new revenue stream for your physicians as well. Depending on location providers can charge 2x 3x 5x for treatments.  
As you can imagine there are a large amount of applications because of compensation model, so we have to cap applicants at some point. With that said, if you have the connections in the specialties above, apply now with your availability and we will be in touch soon.

**Biotech Medical Sales Representative responsibilities include:**

* Assessing clients needs and present suitable promoted products
* Liaising with and persuading targeted doctors to prescribe our products utilizing effective sales skills
* Providing product information and deliver product samples

**Job brief:**

We are looking for a competitive Biotech Sales Representative, with emphasis of stem cell therapy and exosomes, who can thrive in a fast-paced business environment. Looking for individuals familiar with PRP and other regen treatments. The Biotech Sales Rep will act as the key link between our company and healthcare professionals and you will aim at meeting sales objectives. As a Biotech Sales Rep, your goal is to increase the visibility and awareness of our company’s unique and market leading medical products, while maximizing sales growth.

Exosomes are nano-sized biovesicles released into surrounding body fluids upon fusion of multivesicular bodies and the plasma membrane. They were shown to carry cell-specific cargos of proteins, lipids, and genetic materials, and can be selectively taken up by neighboring or distant cells far from their release, reprogramming the recipient cells upon their bioactive compounds. Therefore, the regulated formation of exosomes, specific makeup of their cargo, cell-targeting specificity are of immense biological interest considering extremely high potential of exosomes as non-invasive diagnostic biomarkers, as well as therapeutic nanocarriers. We focus on the potential use of exosomes as valuable diagnostic and prognostic biomarkers for their cell-lineage and state-specific contents, and possibilities as therapeutic vehicles for drug and gene delivery. Exosomes carry great regenerative properties. We are looking to share and distribute these to the providers that are utilizing current stem cell therapy. Also ones that are using platelet rich plasma, an extremely painful and 7000x less effective treatment.

Be first to market in your territory and speak at a high level about the benefits of Regenerative Medicine!

**Responsibilities:**

* Assess clients needs and present suitable promoted products
* Liaise with and persuade targeted doctors to prescribe our products utilizing effective selling skills and performing cost-benefit analysis
* Call points will include, but not limited to... Med Spas, Neurologists, Orthopedic, Dermatologists, Spine and Joint Specialists, Women's Health, Men's Health, Surgical, and Pain Management
* Provide product information and deliver product samples
* Attend sales meetings, conference calls, training sessions and symposium circuits
* Work with sales team to develop strategies and implement brand strategies to ensure a consistent marketing message
* Build positive trust relationships with medical representatives to influence targeted group in the decision making process
* Monitor and analyze data and market conditions to identify competitive advantage Keep accurate records and documentation for reporting and feedback
* Pursue continuous learning and professional development and stay up-to-date with latest medical data

**Requirements and skills:**

* Proven work experience and success as a Biotech or Medical Sales Rep
* Familiarity with databases, statistics, stem cell therapy and latest medical issues in the space
* Knowledge of MS Office
* Excellent communication, negotiation and sales skills
* Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* BS degree in relevant field

Look forward to hearing from you!

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT)
description:
**Position Summary:**  
As a Certified Pharmacy Technician, you will play a crucial role in supporting pharmacy operations, ensuring exceptional patient care, and upholding regulatory standards within the healthcare environment. Your responsibilities will involve collaborating with pharmacists, healthcare professionals, and patients to facilitate medication dispensing and enhance overall pharmacy services.

Responsibilities of a Pharmacy Technician

* **Medication Dispensing:**
* Accurately fill and label prescription orders, ensuring correct medications, dosages, and instructions.
* Prepare medications for dispensing, including counting tablets, measuring liquids, and labeling containers.
* **Prescription Management:**
* Receive and process prescription orders from patients and healthcare providers.
* Verify prescription details and patient information to ensure accuracy and legality.
* **Patient Interaction:**
* Provide excellent customer service, addressing patient inquiries and concerns about medications and pharmacy services.
* Assist patients with over-the-counter medication selections and general health advice.
* **Medication Safety:**
* Check for drug interactions, contraindications, and allergies to ensure safe medication use.
* Report any medication errors, adverse reactions, or discrepancies to the Pharmacist.
* **Inventory Management:**
* Monitor and manage medication inventory, including ordering, receiving, and restocking supplies.
* Conduct regular inventory checks and manage expired or damaged medications.
* **Record Keeping:**
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of prescriptions, medication dispensed, and patient profiles.
* Ensure proper documentation for controlled substances and other regulated medications.
* **Administrative Duties:**
* Process insurance claims and manage billing for medications and pharmacy services.
* Handle administrative tasks such as filing, data entry, and managing pharmacy supplies.
* **Pharmacy Cleanliness:**
* Maintain a clean and organized work environment, including pharmacy counters, storage areas, and equipment.
* Follow hygiene and safety protocols to ensure a sanitary workspace.
* **Medication Storage:**
* Ensure proper storage conditions for medications, including temperature control and security.
* Organize medications and supplies in a manner that facilitates easy retrieval and prevents errors.
* **Compliance:**
* Adhere to all federal, state, and local regulations and pharmacy policies.
* Assist the Pharmacist in maintaining compliance with legal and ethical standards.
* **Communication:**
* Collaborate with Pharmacists, healthcare providers, and other pharmacy staff to ensure effective workflow and patient care.
* Relay important information about medication changes or patient instructions as directed by the Pharmacist.
* **Professional Development:**
* Stay updated with current pharmaceutical knowledge and industry best practices.
* Participate in continuing education and training as required.

By fulfilling these duties, you will contribute significantly to the smooth operation of the pharmacy, ensuring patient safety, satisfaction, and compliance with regulatory standards.

Expected hours: 40 per week

* 8 hour shift

* Edison, NJ (Required)

title: Physical Education Teacher
description:
**Positions Report to:** Instructional Leadership Team


**Start Date:** Immediate


**Hours:** 8:00 am – 4:30 pm + some out of school time responsibilities


**Compensation:** (Please note that this is a general range - salaries are determined based on credentials (degree/continuing education & certification) & years of experience. East Harlem Scholars Academies also offers a comprehensive benefits package):


* Bachelors: $66,000 - $144,000
* Masters: $75,000 - $150,000


**FLSA Status:** Exempt

  


**Who We Are**



East Harlem Scholars Academies are community-based Pre-K to 12 public charter schools operated by East Harlem Tutorial Program (EHTP). EHTP began in 1958 as a children's reading group and has since grown into a multi-site after-school program for traditional public school students and a network of public charter schools focused on significantly increasing the college graduation rate in East Harlem. We are on track to serve at least 25% of East Harlem students by 2025, with enrollment for this year at approximately 2200 students in our schools and after school programs. In 2020, 99% of our seniors were accepted to college, and our current scholars in college are on-track to graduate at eight times the national average of their peers.



At EHTP we also aim to serve as an agent of change and thoughtfully contribute to the national fight for racial equity. Through our organization-wide commitment to anti-racism work, we prepare our scholars to effect change, challenge the status quo, and thrive in the world around them. As staff members, we face our own racial identities and conscious and unconscious biases. With this in mind, all of our professional development, curriculum, organizational materials, and processes are designed with a goal of racial justice. Read our racial equity statement **here**.



We ground all of our work in racial equity, **in our core values**, and in our four guiding pursuits: the Revolutionary Pursuit of Love, the Radical Pursuit of Knowledge, the Responsive Pursuit of Healing, and in the Relentless Pursuit of Results. These pursuits inform and are reflected in our current four key strategic priorities: to increase high-impact, high-quality academic curriculum, programming content, staff capacity, and coaching; to embrace and advance our use of technology; to deepen our embodiment of ethical and equitable radical humanity; and to efficiently operationalize teaching, learning, community, and care.



For more information about Scholars Academies, please visit us at www.eastharlemscholars.org.


**About the Opportunity**



As a teacher with Scholars Academies you will be student facing the majority of the day. You will work closely with your team and the instructional leadership team to internalize, and in some cases develop curriculum; provide high-quality instruction; track and measure student progress; create a positive classroom and school culture, and to engage in reflection and continuous improvement. As a team we will work together to prepare students with the skills, strength of character, and emotional well-being to excel academically, lead in their communities, and realize their best possible selves.



For more details about the role, please click here.


**Who You Are**


* You have experience teaching Physical Education/Fitness within grades PreK - 12th
* You hold yourself to high professional and ethical standards
* You have experience with, or are excited about researching best practices in anti-racist pedagogy
* You enjoy and/or have experience working with diverse populations of students and communities
* You believe that every student can and will learn when provided with a quality education
* You have demonstrated success in fostering the artistic proficiency of students who historically have not had equitable access to education opportunities
* You are willing to be flexible in your role and adapt to school and student needs
* You are committed to continuous improvement and learning through professional development
* You have a minimum of two-year's experience in relevant educational positions (preferred)
* You have a Bachelor's Degree, or higher, and appropriate NYS certifications (preferred)


*Please note that many do not meet 100% of the desired qualifications. If much of this describes you, we encourage you to still apply.*


**Areas of Leadership**


* Demonstrate successful partnership with classroom co-teacher and utilize multiple co-teaching models in the classroom
* Embodiment and effective modeling of our core values for students to exhibit and practice them
* Sets ambitious goals based on backwards planning, demonstrating locus of control, and aligned with an overall vision for student success, content to be learned, personal knowledge of students, and overall instructional context
* Demonstrates deep knowledge of content and effective pedagogy, evidenced by clear and objective-driven instruction.and meaningful student engagement through active learning practices
* Staff member sets clear expectations and institutes routines so as to establish and maintain a purposeful, supportive, and fun environment for learning, in which students feel safe, valued, and respected by adults and their peers
* Builds a classroom community where restorative practices are actively modeled and used to navigate student and community challenges
* Demonstrates a Team First mindset, through proactive contributions to the community, and advances his/her practice through reflection, development opportunities, participation in the professional community, and actively engaging families and community members


**Thank you in advance for taking the time to apply to East Harlem Scholars Academies.**

title: Regulatory Affairs Manager, Certifications & Labeling
description:
**Location:** NYC


### **About Daily Harvest**



At Daily Harvest we take care of food, so food can take care of you. We're committed to helping you nourish your body while taking care of the planet. How? By making it easy to eat more real, unrefined and sustainably sourced fruits and vegetables every day. Our team is collaborative, driven, and future-thinking. We're constantly learning, experimenting, and iterating, and celebrate failure just as much as success. We take risks, try new things, and we get things done. We love adaptogens and cruciferous vegetables but never say no to cake. Everything we do, we do in the service of our community.


### **Position Overview**



The Certifications Regulatory Affairs Manager will own and oversee the maintenance of third-party certifications. The incumbent will serve as subject matter expert (SME) for certifications on Daily Harvest products. This role will partner with Procurement, Legal, and Food Safety Quality Assurance (FSQA) to ensure certifications related documentation and materials are accurately maintained and up-to-date. This role will lead annual QAI Organic Certification audits and will partner closely with supplier partners to ensure certification status is maintained throughout the DH supply chain. The role will report directly to the VP of Technical Services with a dotted line reporting to the General Counsel.



The ideal candidate will be a SME in USDA Organic regulations, possess strong organizational and technical skills, thrive in a fast-paced consumer-centric organization, and value the opportunity to have a big impact in supporting Daily Harvest's rapid growth. Accountability, integrity, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and work independently are required for this position. This is an exceptional opportunity for the right candidate who is interested in working at a groundbreaking omni-channel food CPG company.


### **What you'll do:**


* Work independently to collect and review documentation to substantiate certified claims for USDA Organic, and Non-GMO Project certification
* Lead the annual Daily Harvest QAI certification audit
* Partner with the FSQA team to set priorities for documentation management
* Provide regulatory guidance and answer certification-related questions regarding new and reformulated product concepts
* Set priorities for review and update of certification program related SOPs
* Work closely with third-party manufacturing partners on any new product organic submissions
* Ensures that all required information is available for review and approval of all raw materials
* Partners with Sourcing, Culinary, and Planning teams to resolve any queries on the status of suppliers or specific required documentation for certifications
* Challenges the status quo to improve ways of working, being vocal with ideas about current processes and systems
* Effectively communicate continuous improvement opportunities to key stakeholders
* Partner with DH Legal team to support regulatory review of new or updated product labels

### **Who you are:**


* Bachelor's Degree – Type: Food Science, Nutrition, or related combination of technical degrees and Food Regulatory experience
* Minimum of 5 years experience in the food industry, primarily in regulatory affairs, regulatory compliance or technical related fields
* Demonstrated knowledge of third-party certifications: USDA Organic, Non-GMO Project, Gluten-Free, Kosher
* Understanding of 21 CFR regulations
* Proficiency in Tracegains or similar supplier management software systems
* Detail-oriented and strong organizational skills
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* Proven ability to stay current on regulatory changes
* Ability to work independently and interface with external and internal stakeholders.
* Ability to read and understand vendor documentation
* Strong verbal and written communications
* Proficiency (intermediate to advanced) in computer applications and systems including G-Suite and Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)


The anticipated annual base salary range for this role is $100,000 - $130,000. Actual compensation will be commensurate with experience, qualifications, knowledge, and skills.


### **Benefits:**


* Flexible PTO Plan + working hours
* Equity participation + 401K
* Competitive medical, dental, + vision insurance
* Virtual and IRL team building events and activities (social hours, L&D opportunities, celebrations, and more)
* Ancillary benefits: Commuter, Citi Bike discounts, + Health & Wellness Perks
* Discounted subscription to Daily Harvest (30% off) + free shipping
* Unlimited Daily Harvest in the office to keep you hustling, not hangry (...always stocked)


*At Daily Harvest, our mission is to take care of food, so that food can take care of you. And it wouldn't be possible without our team. We celebrate the unique POV that each person brings to the table and believe in a collaborative and inclusive environment. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, military or veteran status, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetic information. These are our guiding principles and apply across all aspects of employment*

  


***CPRA Applicant Employee Notice and Privacy Policy***

title: Engineering Test Technician
description:
Come grow with Marotta! One of NJ’s fastest growing technology companies, **named a New Jersey Top Workplace for 2022 & 2023, and a 2022 “Made in New Jersey” Manufacturer of the Year Award Winner.**You will have room to grow and be a part of an exciting team, all within a warm and welcoming environment.
Marotta Controls, Inc. specializes in the design, development, and production of precision control components and systems. Founded in 1943, Marotta has been at the forefront of Aerospace & Defense milestones for over 80 years from breaking the sound barrier on the Bell X-1 and landing the first man on the moon to playing a critical role on today’s advanced U.S Navy platforms as well as the emerging commercial pace industry.  


Our products and expertise range from high performance valves to complete sub-systems that integrate electronic controls, actuators, and power conversion systems. We have received over 200 patents for our technologies and support the most demanding applications found on military aircraft, tactical systems, submarines, surface ships, satellites and space launch vehicles. Our teams have repeatedly been recognized for outstanding performance by some of the most prestigious organizations in the world including The Boeing Company, Lockheed Martin, NASA & Northrop Grumman.  



**Engineering Test Technician**  

**Position Profile****:**
The Engineering Test Technician is a hands-on position responsible for independently assembling, testing and troubleshooting of electrical/electronic assemblies and systems.  


Minimum Required Qualifications:
* Associates Degree in Electronics or equivalent
* Minimum 7 years of related experience in an electronics engineering/production environment, or combination of experience and education
* Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with using hand tools, soldering irons, crimpers, torque wrenches, screwdrivers, pliers and test equipment
* Self-motivated: capable of running multiple projects at the same time and on schedule, with the ability to analyze, organize, plan, prioritize assignments, and achieve results
* Excellent analog and digital skills, possess strong problem solving ability
* Strong verbal/written communication skills required for multi-faceted interactions with all levels of personnel within the organization
* Computer literate, with MS Office/PC expertise
* Knowledge of ESD and FOD principles
* Soldering & rework skills a plus
* Must be a US Citizen


Essential or Primary / Key Responsibilities:
* Utilize Oscilloscope, meters and various test equipment appropriately for effective troubleshooting / diagnosis
* Read and interpret electrical schematics for circuit card troubleshooting
* Ability to troubleshoot circuit cards down to component level
* Ensure test data sheets are completed and generate failure analysis
* Ensure that all activities related to product are executed and documented in a manner which is compliant to corporate and regulatory requirements
* Facilitate all testing both in house and at outside test facilities
* Generate action plans and strategies to support and accommodate testing and development of new products
* Maintain and optimize the required support systems (computer/personnel) to manage, assuring on-time results while achieving desired objectives
* Utilize fixtures and test setups that will make testing more complete and efficient
* Effectively communicate exceptions to established/agreed upon schedules to all affected parties internal/external to the Marotta Organization

Additional Duties / Responsibilities:
* Bring initiatives and activities to closure in a timely manner through effective interaction with individuals, both internal and external to the Marotta organization (as required).
* Ensure self, and personnel company-wide, are abiding by all safety, quality, housekeeping and company policies/procedures to ensure compliance to all regulatory and internal system requirements.
* Foster a positive and cooperative work environment through effective communication at all levels internal and external to the organization
* Actively participate in team meetings, improvement initiatives/programs, etc. to provide constructive recommendations and initiate actions to support company initiatives/goals
* Involvement in a continuous improvement environment
* Consistently demonstrate commitment to company values
* Keep management informed of area activities and of any significant problems.
* Develop and maintain constructive and cooperative working relationships with personnel at all levels, company-wide
* Assume responsibility for related duties as required or assigned.
* Ensure that work area is clean, secure, and well maintained.
* Complete special projects and miscellaneous assignments as required.

Work Environment:
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to conditions typical of a manufacturing/machine shop environment, including, but not limited to: fluids, fumes or airborne particles, moving mechanical parts, electronic/electrical hazards, and noise and vibration
* This job interacts both in a professional office environment and a manufacturing/machine shop environment. This role uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines, as well as environments inclusive of the appropriate eye, hearing and foot protection (as required).
* Temperature of work environment may be affected by outside/external temperatures, machining processes, etc.
* Overtime and weekend work may be required, as job duties demand.
* Some travel may be required for this position (5-10%)
Physical Requirements:
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear.
* The employee is frequently required to repetitively use/reach with hands and arms, and to use hands to finger, handle or feel.
	+ Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
* The employee is regularly required to stand at length, sit, walk, stoop, bend, turn, balance, and/or crouch, and move about the facility.
* **The employee may be required to lift, stack, push, pull and/or move items weighing up to 20 pounds**


**Attractive Work Schedule: 4-Day Work Week – Monday-Thursday (6:00AM-4:30PM), OT available**  

This position is at our Montville, NJ corporate offices location.  


Many of our contracts require proof that you are a U.S. citizen and/or that an export license has been obtained for employees who are citizens of certain countries. Your employment, both initially and continually thereafter, is conditioned on production of such proof of citizenship and/or any export license that may be required to comply with any and all applicable laws, regulations, or executive orders, or required by Federal, State, or local government contracts.
We offer a highly competitive compensation package for this outstanding position plus a quarterly bonus along with a full range of top quality benefits and employee services including: medical, prescription, dental, vision, life and disability income insurance programs, 401k retirement plans with company match, generous tuition aid program, paid vacation, sick and personal days, paid holidays and flexible work hours with compressed work week options. We recognize and reward our employee's accomplishments and host several employee engagement events per quarter.
If you are looking to grow or accelerate your career and be part of a best in class organization while enjoying a work-life balance, please visit our website at www.marotta.com to learn more about us and to apply. Check out all of our openings at https://marotta.com/job-openings/  


We are an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity employer M/F/IWD/Veterans
VETERANS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY

**No agencies, please.**

title: Linen Attendant - Greenwich Hospital
description:
**Linen Attendant- Greenwich Hospital**
Unitex is experiencing unprecedented growth! Due to this growth, we are in search of a Linen Attendant for our facility at Greenwich Hospital.  

  

**Compensation:** $16.00/hr. The salary range for this position is $16.00/hour to $16.00/hour. Actual compensation decisions are based on factors such as experience, seniority, location, and other permissible job-related factors.  

  

**Duties and responsibilities (including but not limited to):**
* Distribute linens to various departments within the hospital
* Load and unload scrub machines
* Stock and restock shelves

**Required Skills:**
* MUST have flexibility to work various hours (mornings, evenings, weekends) totaling 40 hours per week
* Must be able to lift loads of linens and push carts filled with linens - approx. 300 pounds


  

This is an entry level position. No experience is required.  

  

Unitex offers a competitive compensation package including health insurance, 401K with employer matching, paid vacation, sick days, etc.  

  

Visit our website at www.unitex.com to learn more about our company and watch our recruiting video at https://youtu.be/5XgjhF0ubnw to see us in action and hear from our employees.  


EOE  


*About Unitex:*  


*For more than 100 years, our family-run business has been leading the way in the medical uniform and linen rental industry. Today, with 1900 employees and growing, we are the largest family-owned healthcare service provider in the country.*  


*Every single day, Unitex is behind the scenes cleaning, preparing and delivering the linen that helps healthcare professionals provide the best care to their patients from fresh sheets to warm blankets, comfortable gowns and clean towels.*  


*Unitex is an essential service to the healthcare industry which translates to a safe and stable workplace that makes it easy for people to apply their skills to become successful in every one of our roles. Due to our past, current and future expansions, we actively hire drivers, mechanics and production operators, clerical positions and various management and outside sales roles. All of Unitex’ s roles include competitive pay, medical benefits, PTO time and more. We are committed to training, developing and promoting our employees. Those with a solid work ethic, who are self-motivated, reliable and flexible succeed at Unitex.*  


*When it comes to stable, long-term employment with diverse growth opportunities, Unitex has it all. Join Unitex and become part of a winning team.*  


*Unitex Recruitment video:* https://youtu.be/5XgjhF0ubnw

title: Project Management Associate, MarTech
description:
**ABOUT FANDUEL**



FanDuel Group ("FanDuel") is an innovative sports-tech entertainment company that is changing the way consumers engage with their favorite sports, teams, and leagues. The premier gaming destination in the United States, FanDuel consists of a portfolio of leading brands across gaming, sports betting, daily fantasy sports, advance-deposit wagering, and TV/media.



FanDuel has a presence across all 50 states with approximately 17 million customers and 28 retail locations. FanDuel is based in New York with offices in New Jersey, Georgia, California, Oregon, Canada and Scotland.



Its networks FanDuel TV and FanDuel+ are broadly distributed on linear cable television and through its relationships with leading direct-to-consumer over-the-top platforms.



FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment plc, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FLUT).


**THE ROSTER**



At FanDuel, we give fans a new and innovative way to interact with their favorite games, sports and teams. We're dedicated to building a winning team and we pride ourselves on being able to make every moment mean more, especially when it comes to your career. So, what does "winning" look like at FanDuel? It's recognition for your hard-earned results, a culture that brings out your best work—and a roster full of talented coworkers. Make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From creatives professionals to cutting edge technology innovators, FanDuel offers a wide range of career opportunities, best in class benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. At FanDuel, our principle of "We Are One Team" runs through all our offices across the globe, and you can expect to be a part of an exciting company with many opportunities to grow and be successful.


**THE POSITION**  

Our roster has an opening with your name on it



FanDuel is looking for a dynamic Project Manager with 2+ years of experience to join our MarTech and Ops team. This role is pivotal in driving operational efficiency and project success across multiple departments, including but not limited to CRM Operations, Promotion Operations, Brand, Data Science, Product, Strategy, and Customer Service. The ideal candidate will thrive in a highly cross-functional environment, adept at managing diverse projects and collaborating closely with various teams. This is an exciting opportunity to help elevate the MarTech and Ops team's ways of working and help the team champion process efficiency at a premier gaming company.


**THE GAME PLAN**  

Everyone on our team has a part to play


* Manage end-to-end project lifecycle for MarTech and Ops initiatives, ensuring delivery within scope, and timeline constraints.
* Collaborate with cross functional stakeholders including Product, developers, CRM Operations, Promotion Operations, Brand, Data Science, Product, Strategy, and Customer Service, et. al to define project goals, objectives, and success criteria.
* Conduct regular project status meetings, providing updates to stakeholders and senior management on project progress, risks, and issues.
* Utilize project management tools and methodologies to plan, track, and report project milestones and deliverables.
* Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently with focus on interdependencies.
* Support the implementation of MarTech solutions and operational workflows, leveraging industry best practices and continuous improvement methodologies.
* Facilitate cross-functional communication and alignment, fostering a collaborative environment focused on achieving business objectives.


**THE STATS**  

What we're looking for in our next teammate


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* 2+ years of experience in project management within MarTech, Digital Marketing, or Operations.
* Proven track record of successfully managing multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong understanding of digital marketing operations and technologies, with a focus on CRM, promotions, and customer engagement.
* Experience working with cross-functional teams including Brand, Data Science, Product, Strategy, and Customer Service.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas to diverse audiences.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. Knowledge of sports and/or experience working within a heavily regulated industry is a plus.
* PMP certification is a plus, though not required.
* Experience working with Atlassian tools (JIRA and Confluence) is a plus.
* Additional certifications such as Lean Six Sigma or Agile are advantageous.
* Don't check all the boxes? That's okay! We encourage you to still apply if you feel like you possess an adjacent skillet and are interested in learning more about this position.


**PLAYER BENEFITS**  

We treat our team right



From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give. Competitive compensation is just the beginning. As part of our team, you can expect:


* An exciting and fun environment committed to driving real growth
* Opportunities to build really cool products that fans love
* Mentorship and professional development resources to help you refine your game
* Be well, save well and live well - with FanDuel Total Rewards your benefits are one highlight reel after another


FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer and we believe, as one of our principal states, "We Are One Team!" We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, Veteran status, or another other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included. We want our team to include diverse individuals because diversity of thought, diversity of perspectives, and diversity of experiences leads to better performance. Having a diverse and inclusive workforce is a core value that we believe makes FanDuel stronger and more competitive as One Team!


***The applicable salary range for this position is $74,000-$92,000, which is dependent on a variety of factors including relevant experience, location, business needs and market demand. This role may offer the following benefits: medical, vision, and dental insurance; life insurance; disability insurance; a 401(k) matching program; among other employee benefits. This role may also be eligible for short-term or long-term incentive compensation, including, but not limited to, cash bonuses and stock program participation. This role includes paid personal time off and 14 paid company holidays. FanDuel offers paid sick time in accordance with all applicable state and federal laws.***
