title: Research Technician B
description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Departments of Radiology and Neuroscience at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine are seeking a Research Technician on an NIH-funded project investigating chemotherapy-induced cognitive deficits in childhood survivors of leukemia.  

A highly motivated individual with strong organizational, interpersonal and computer skills is required; prior experience with packages such as Matlab is preferred, but training will be provided for candidates if needed. Candidates familiar with MRI image processing software packages, especially with task-based fMRI, will be given preference. A strong work ethic, excellent organizational and communication skills are expected. Willingness to learn new techniques or software environments and a strong foundation in neuroanatomy are a plus. Writing experience, the ability to work independently and research experience with children are not necessary but favorable.  

This is a one-year position, with renewal dependent upon continuation of funding.
  

Primary responsibilities include:* Overseeing MRI protocol implementation, preparing children (ages 5-12) for their MRI session, and performing cognitive testing.
* Data organization and preparation for analysis, training will be provided.
* Post-processing of MRI and behavioral data for analyses, training will be provided.
* Maintaining records and assisting with IRB compliance/documentation.
* Data management, quality control, and recording keeping, including creating graphs, figures, and tables.
* Assisting with preparation of abstracts, manuscripts and annual reports.

QUALIFICATIONS:  

* BA or BS degree in related science or equivalent, skills and experience of 0-2 years’; MA/MS candidates are encouraged to apply. Background in physical sciences, neuroscience or engineering preferred, but not required. Interested candidates should send their CV and the names and phone numbers of three references to Mark Wagshul (mark.wagshul@einsteinmed.edu). Review of applications will begin immediately and continue until the position is filled.


Hiring Rate: $26.00 Post Probationary Rate: $26.54 Job Rate: $27.36 About Us:

The Albert Einstein College of Medicine is a leading academic institution, with over $170M in NIH funding. Einstein is one of the nation’s premier institutions for medical education, basic research, and clinical investigation. It is home to some 2,000 faculty members, 750 M.D. students, 350 Ph.D. students attending the Sue Golding Graduate Division — including 125 in the combined M.D./Ph.D. program — and 325 postdoctoral investigators training at our Belfer Institute for Advanced Biomedical Studies. More than 7,000 Einstein alumni are among the nation’s foremost clinicians, biomedical scientists, and medical educators.
The Albert Einstein College of Medicine is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. Einstein seeks candidates whose skills, and personal and professional experience, have prepared them to contribute to our commitment to diversity and excellence, and the communities we serve.

title: Verifier / HERS Rater - Passive House
description:
**About the Role:** Steven Winter Associates, Inc. (SWA) is looking for an entry level Passive House Field Verifier (PH) to join our High Performance Building Solutions (HPBS) team. In this role, you will support evaluating and verifying projects designed or built to meet the PH standard. This role includes collaborating with construction teams, architects, and engineers to ensure compliance. The ideal candidate has a strong interest in sustainable building practices, a desire to develop expertise in PH certification, and strong communication skills for both fieldwork and progress reporting. Certified professionals in International or US PH standards are invited to apply.


The proposed annual salary range for this position is $65,000 - $75,000 based on a 40-hour work schedule. The final salary may vary depending on confirmed job-related skills and experience.


**Primary Responsibilities:** The role requires a self-starter able to work independently both in a group environment and in the field.


* Assist in the verification of Passive House projects to ensure compliance with the Passive House standard, including construction site observations, performance testing, and documentation review.
* Conduct on-site inspections to assess construction quality and adherence to Passive House guidelines with close attention to detail. Report findings and recommend corrective actions as needed.
* Review project documentation, including drawings and specifications, for compliance with Passive House standards.
* Perform basic calculations and measurements.
* Prepare reports and documentation for PH certification.
* Collaborate with project teams, architects, engineers, and contractors to address any issues related to Passive House certification and provide technical support.
* Participate in training sessions and professional development opportunities to stay current with Passive House standards, methodologies, and best practices.


**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in architecture, engineering, sustainable construction management or related degree with an emphasis on buildings and their operational systems.
* Relevant coursework, internships, academic projects or certifications related to sustainable building practices and energy efficiency is advantageous.
* 0-2 years of experience with building projects in North America.
* Comprehensive understanding of energy use in buildings.
* Advanced knowledge of Excel and proficiency in MS Office Suite.
* Testing experience using blower door, duct blaster, and infrared camera equipment is a plus.

**Preferred knowledge:**

* Experience working on Passive House projects is a plus.
* Previous rating experience as a HERS Rater, LEED Homes Green Rater and/or NGBS Green Verifier, or other credential demonstrating mastery of high-performance building strategies.
* Willingness and ability to obtain applicable certifications through PHI, PHIUS, and/or ENERGY STAR Multifamily New Construction within 1 year of employment.


**Bonus technical skills / certifications:**

* Experience field verifying buildings, especially for green certifications or code compliance is a plus.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:** While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and frequently required to walk; use hands to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is often required to stand while at project sites. The employee may be required to lift or move objects up to 35 pounds.


There will be occasional long days on construction sites for performance testing (e.g. blower door) which can be physically demanding. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision and the ability to adjust focus.


**TRAVEL REQUIRED:** Occasional overnight travel may be required (Less than 10%). Frequent local field visits in the NYC Metro area will be necessary (estimated at 40%-60%).


A valid and clean U.S. driving license is required.


**WORKING ENVIRONMENT:** This role involves a combination of office and fieldwork; however, most duties will be conducted in a construction/field environment, which will involve trips to projects sites for observation and training. The remainder of the duties will be performed in an office environment.


**EEO AND DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION (DEI):**


SWA is an **Equal Opportunity Employer** – all qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or marital status.


**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI):** SWA is a workplace where we are aware and welcoming of the ways in which we are all diverse as evidenced by a culture of listening and understanding. We endeavor to create a workplace where people feel empowered to act; a safe place where people are open to discussing different views; ongoing education opportunities around diversity, equity, and inclusion; and to build a culture of belonging and accountability.

title: Campus Undergraduate - 2025 Enterprise China Management Summer Internship New York, NY
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



**Business Unit/Role Specific Info:**

  



In August 2020, American Express launched a new network in mainland China through our joint venture (JV), Express Company (EC). As the first foreign network to operate in China, this represents an exciting opportunity for Amex to compete in one of the largest and most advanced payments markets in the world. Following the commercial launch of the JV, the Enterprise China Management (ECM) team was created to focus on partnering with EC to build our business in China.



The role will be embedded in the ECM team and will be focused on working with other American Express teams along with members of EC to build out capabilities, manage services and platforms provided to EC, and support longer-term initiatives for the business.



**How will you make an impact in this role?**


* Support ongoing development and optimization of JV performance-tracking systems and processes (developing stakeholder engagement plans, conducting research to support opportunity evaluation, etc.)
* Promote socialization of ECM initiatives throughout the enterprise (identify town hall showcase opportunities, improve internal visibility of local initiatives, etc.)
* Share relevant insights on China consumer and industry trends.
* Partner with colleagues across ECM to develop a deepened understanding of our business globally as well as within China.


This position will be based in New York, NY



**Minimum Qualifications**


* Currently enrolled in a full-time bachelor’s degree program
* Students must have a graduation date between December 2025 and June 2026.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Proficiency in Mandarin strongly preferred
* Proactive, highly organized self-starter with experience handling complex projects
* Eagerness and ability to learn quickly, knowledge of payment networks and financial products a plus
* Ability to focus on the big picture while being attentive to detail
* Proven ability to drive workstreams and recommend clear next steps
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to build relationships with business partners across a diverse set of cultures; international exposure / experience (particularly in Asia / China) a plus
* Strong work ethic, flexibility to work across multiple time zones


Salary Range: $24.05 to $63.00 hourly + sign-on bonus



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries
* Flexible work arrangements and schedules with hybrid and virtual options with Amex Flex
* Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
* Free and confidential counselling support through our Healthy Minds program
* Career development and training opportunities


For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.



American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.



We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.

Business Unit/Role Specific Info


We are looking for sophomore candidates with a strong-work ethic, intellectual curiosity, ability to build relations and an interest in financial services to be part of a summer leadership program. Students from all schools are encouraged to apply. Our sophomore internship program helps align with our commitment to make sure our colleagues are as diverse as our customers and the communities we serve by focusing on attracting promising students from groups underrepresented in the financial industry.

  




Whether you’re working with a business unit focused on the consumers, small businesses, or major corporations, you’ll have the opportunity and resources available to make an impact. It sounds exciting because it is. Explore a Finance summer internship at American Express and earn the trust and respect of our customers and colleagues every day. The internship will be a general Finance internship that will provide opportunities to intern in one of the following functional areas of Finance: Corporate Planning & Analysis, Global Commercial Services Finance, Global Consumer Services Group Finance, Global Merchant and Network Services Finance, Controllership, Global Treasury, and Investor Relations.



This position will be based in New York, NY



**How will you make an impact in this role?**



All interns receive a project solving a real business challenge for the organization. Examples of past projects include:



* Provide best-in-class analysis and decision support to the Finance organization
* Learn how to articulate decisions clearly and gain buy-in from stakeholders across the business
* Gather and analyze information from a wide array of sources; identify trends and articulate how those trends impact our businesses
* Obtain a comprehensive understanding of the business and its needs
* Hone analytical acumen, communication skills, and the ability to tailor complex messages to the appropriate audience


Minimum Qualifications



* Currently enrolled in a full-time bachelor’s degree program
* Students must have a graduation date between December 2026 and June 2027.


**Preferred Qualifications**

* Strategic thought leadership skills and creativity
* Financial and analytical skills with an eye towards developing recommendations to drive growth for our businesses
* A strong work-ethic and robust interpersonal skills, showcasing the ability to build trust-based relationships within the Finance team and with business partners across locations / geographies
* Ability to learn our business model and its key financial drivers
* Programming skills a plus


Salary Range: $24.05 to $63.00 hourly + sign-on bonus

title: Social Service Coordinator
description:
Social Service Coordinator for Senior Citizen Apartment Building.

Bi-lingual prefferred. English / Korean

I. Provide for physical, psychological and social needs or the residents and assist in keeping them in their apartments as long as possible, with required and available services.

II. Initiation of placement of tenants no longer able to remain in an independent living setting, and provision of assistance to tenants and family members to do so.

A. Assessments are completed on an initial and an ongoing basis as required. This includes, but is not limited to, areas of Physical, Emotional, Social and Mental Health.

B. Referrals are made to agencies as required or appropriate in the areas of Safety, Finance, Health and Mental Health issues.

C. Family Contact Documentation.

D. Evaluate the resident's home environment.

Referrals are made to the following agencies as appropriate:

Food Stamps Senior Nutrition Sites Food Banks Veterans Services

Medicaid Mental Health/Counseling Services P AAD/Senior Gold Rx Meals on Wheels

Social Security Adult Social/Medical Day Care

Medicare State of NJ Respite, JACC & CARES

Programs

DCA for Section 8 Adult Protective Services

Local Police Nursing Homes

Blind & Visually Impaired Hospice

Bergen County Legal Aid Bergen Co. Mobile Crisis Mental Health

Local Hospital Emergency Rooms Health Insurance Companies

Bergen Co. Senior Services for Case management Services

Bergen Co. Senior Services for Veterans' Services Primary Care Physicians

Referrals are made to programs and agencies providing services and also assist residents or responsible parties in processing form or applications for the following needs:

Support Groups (Cancer, Grief, Dementia, Caregiver, etc.)

Home Care (Private pay and programs Telephone Discount

Counseling Housekeeping (Private pay and programs)

Transportation Medical Equipment

Legal Services Home Safety/Medical Alert Systems

Off Site Annual Social Programs Photo IDs.

Self Neglect/Failure to Thrive

C. The Social Service Coordinator will follow "at risk" tenants until issues are resolved, the tenant is placed, or continue on-going assessments and referrals as needed. When possible, hospitalized tenants will be followed for appropriate and safe transition back to home.

D. Any information obtained by the social worker on a resident will be kept in the strictest of confidence.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $25.00 - $35.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours
* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

Language:

* Korean (Required)
